body:
Hi folks, Last month Honeybee got [PV panels simulation](https://app.box.com/s/70ztpo8xk31zuvxi7qbzcoqd2buioptv) components based on EnergyPlus. Our Ladybug and Honeybee pets love to work together. As a result of this, we are releasing PV simulation components for Ladybug too. They are based on [PVWatts v1](http://pvwatts.nrel.gov) online calculator, supporting crystalline silicon fixed tilt photovoltaics. You can download them [from here](https://app.box.com/s/wu2hkxiav2bujb06fwa42pyattikesg9), or use the [Update Ladbybug](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/video/sync-old-grasshopper-files-with-github-source-code) component instead. If you take the first option, after downloading check if .ghuser files are blocked (right click -> "Properties" and select "Unblock"). You can download the [example files from here](https://app.box.com/s/xfn2h6m62db6p342gnt6u0u3flr3l7j5). Video tutorials will follow in the coming period.   In the very essence these components help you answer the question: "How much energy can my roof, building facade, solar parking... generate if I would populate them with PV panels"? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z3BWMoplk5QKlFCx*BoLz-3t09XwpRA7kbZgiMRkXLXawnKoCZ2XCkKVyyF5cLbBm*kVV8WeHHFLiBU4zSyXvbhcP-wc*tCw/photovoltaics_usage.jpg) They allow definition of different types of losses (snow, age, shading...) which may affect your PV system: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z3BWMoplk5SKli5hVB7-9WdIvC1qAnTs4LdiOxOoi5lYNsNMY6Pziuk0mXUcOCMa*Ledz0Sb4XY6n3BjseCTWQTz60LAe0UZ/photovoltaics_shading.jpg) And can find its optimal tilt and orientation: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Z3BWMoplk5TtG*28T73YiS1aOkyNX37y18aXMerSsbHeeqg*3za9E2wQFEdlrcf4cLj0fxuW1diHeM2sae2lmbn*hsKa*-oe/photovoltaics_optimal.jpg) Or analyse its performance, energy value, consumption, emissions... [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/EMVKhgUIcMtH2jSZ1vdremCuQbf1TGTQNm8HDss9phdYnUlLlqobNwRsheyKGtCsXwRjYnM7dPD59PW3tbttskyrF7vHQORy/photovoltaics_performance.png) By Djordje Spasic and Jason Sensibaugh, with invaluable support of Dr. Frank Vignola, Dr. Jason M. Keith, Paul Gilman, Chris Mackey, Mostapha Sadeghipour Roudsari, Niraj Palsule, Joseph Cunningham and Christopher Weiss.   Thank you for reading, and hope you will enjoy using the components! **EDIT:** From march 27 2017, Ladybug Photovoltaics components support **thin-film** modules as well. References: 1) System losses: [PVWatts v5 Manual](http://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy14osti/62641.pdf), Dobos, NREL, 2014   2) Sun postion equations by Michalsky (1988): [SAM Photovoltaic Model Technical Reference](https://sam.nrel.gov/sites/sam.nrel.gov/files/SAM%20DRAFT%20Photovoltaic%20Reference%20Manual%20May%2014%202014.pdf), Gilman, NREL, 2014 edited by Jason Sensibaugh   3) Angle of incidence for fixed arrays: [PVWatts Version 1 Technical Reference](http://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy14osti/60272.pdf), Dobos, NREL, 2013   4) Plane-of-Array diffuse irradiance by Perez 1990 algorithm:
[PVPMC Sandia National Laboratories](https://pvpmc.sandia.gov/) [SAM Photovoltaic Model Technical Reference](https://sam.nrel.gov/sites/sam.nrel.gov/files/SAM%20DRAFT%20Photovoltaic%20Reference%20Manual%20May%2014%202014.pdf), Gilman, NREL, 2014   5) Sandia PV Array Performance Module Cover: [PVWatts Version 1 Technical Reference](http://www.nrel.gov/docs/fy14osti/60272.pdf), Dobos, NREL, 2013   6) Sandia Thermal Model, Module Temperature and Cell Temperature Models: [Photovoltaic Array [Metenorm 6 Handbook part II: Theory](http://www.univie.ac.at/photovoltaik/vorlesung/ss2012/unit9/meteonorm.pdf), Meteotest 2007
